CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Harland, student, Mt. Washington, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 5, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were advising a Negro high school student, who plans to enter college and is seeking help on choosing a vocation, what field would you suggest that he or she seek as a vocation?" Answer reads: "My choice is medicine. I say that because of the may virulent diseases, like polio and cancer and ailments of the heart, which claim millions of lives every year.  Our best minds should attempt to seek, and find, the curse that must come before we can get rid of these killing diseases everywhere."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Harland wearing eyeglasses and light colored short sleeve polo shirt, standing in front of building with sign that reads "Faith Which... Profess ... Archer... Preacher"
